intro: Xerochlamys tampoketsensis var. rupestris, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, often colorful floral displays. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, showcasing its adaptation to arid and nutrient-poor environments. Its flowers are usually small to medium in size, with intricate patterns and a strong, spicy fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
